sub_title: Intermediate Game Programmer at Vertigo Studios Amsterdam
summary:
I am an Unreal/Unity generalist programmer with a strong work ethic and a keen interest in broadening and deepening my skills. I have professional experience working with Unreal Engine 4 and have made a fully-featured AI plugin for it. I have 5 years of experience in C# development for Unity. I'm fluent in C++ and have made a game engine with OpenGL rendering and Lua scripting support. When programming, I focus on writing readable, maintainable, and reusable code.

I have great communication skills and have often acted as Team Lead in group projects.

When I'm not working, you can find me gaming, reading or exploring exciting new technologies. I occasionally dabble in web design and machine learning.

I also built an adaptive tutorial, and made the intro and outro sequences.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Maks', 'last_name': 'Maisak', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Intermediate Game Programmer at Vertigo Studios Amsterdam'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Cosmin', 'last_name': 'Bararu', 'name': None, 'headline': 'CTO at Dreamlit Games | Moving the Needle Forward in Multiplayer Open-World Gaming | Angel Investor'}]}, {'title': 'Asgard', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': 'In the beginning of the fourth quarter of my first year at Saxion, I took part in a three-week project to create a 3D game. I led a team of 6 people, acting as Lead Programmer and Team Lead. The game is a first-person grappling hook game in a Norse mythology setting.

The project received the maximum grade and won the public choice award for the best game by first-year students at the public exhibition in Oyfo Techniekmuseum in Hengelo.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Maks', 'last_name': 'Maisak', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Intermediate Game Programmer at Vertigo Studios Amsterdam'}]}, {'title': 'Spacewave', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'description': 'Spacewave is a VR Experience where players learn the principles of radar by shooting and catching waves. Each caught wave paints a part of an alien cave with colored dots.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Maks', 'last_name': 'Maisak', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Intermediate Game Programmer at Vertigo Studios Amsterdam'}]}, {'title': 'C++ Game Engine', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'description': 'A C++ OpenGL game engine I made featuring:
- Cache-efficient Entity-Component-System architecture
- Physically-Based Rendering (PBR)
- Lua scripting support
- A versatile resource management system', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Maks', 'last_name': 'Maisak', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Intermediate Game Programmer at Vertigo Studios Amsterdam'}]}, {'title': 'They can hear you', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': 'In the second quartile of second year at Saxion, I led a team of 2 programmers and 4 artists to make a game over the course of 3 weeks. The game is a third-person stealth shooter set in a nuclear wasteland.

Features I worked on include the character controls and camera, a custom editor for interactively editing enemy AI properties like fields of vision and hearing, an interactive tutorial, and an indicator system that shows the enemies location and awareness level no matter where the camera is looking.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Maks', 'last_name': 'Maisak', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Intermediate Game Programmer at Vertigo Studios Amsterdam'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Cosmin', 'last_name': 'Bararu', 'name': None, 'headline': 'CTO at Dreamlit Games | Moving the Needle Forward in Multiplayer Open-World Gaming | Angel Investor'}]}, {'title': 'Island Defence', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': 'In the third quarter of my first year at Saxion, as part of an introductory course in Unity3D, I was tasked with making a game to prove a basic level of expertise in Unity. To that end, I designed and implemented a first-person shooter with a variety of features, showcasing work with various systems of Unity, ranging from work with audio and physics to making an interactive tutorial and writing custom shaders.

The game received the maximum grade.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Maks', 'last_name': 'Maisak', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Intermediate Game Programmer at Vertigo Studios Amsterdam'}]}]
